quest.name: Dramatis Personae
journal: Keiten knows of someone seeking your acquaintance.
Lina Mewrilah and a young maid by the name of Alma seek not only your acquaintance, but your aid, as well. Follow the pair to the airship landing to learn more.
It appears that Alma will only speak from the safety of her airship, currently berthed in the skies above Kugane. Approach Lina Mewrilah when you are ready to board the shuttle.

Lina informs you that the theater barge belongs to the Majestic Imperial Theater Company, of which Alma is a member. Speak with the young girl in the tiring room.

※Future visits to the Prima Vista can be made by speaking with the shuttle pilot stationed at the airship landing.

You learn that the Majestic Imperial Theater Company was forced to flee the Empire after its founder and principal, Jenomis cen Lexentale, refused to cease his criticism of the government. There is, however, more to the story...and if you wish to hear it, you will need to proceed to the bridge.

Jenomis apparently believed that the Zodiac Brave Story─a legend known to all Garleans─was more than a mere bedtime tale, and set off to the Royal City of Rabanastre in the recently annexed kingdom of Dalmasca hoping to prove his theory. Contact with the principal, however, was lost soon after his departure, and he has not been heard from since. Speak with Jenomis's son Ramza on the bridge to find out your role in proceedings.
Ramza is planning an expedition to locate and rescue his father, and your assistance has been grudgingly accepted. Speak with the youth again when you are ready to depart for Dalmasca.
objectives: Speak with Alma in the tiring room.
Speak with Ramza on the bridge.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Welcome, miladymilord. There is a young maiden here who would speak with you.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Miss! The adventurer has arrived!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: And here shehe is! The liberator of both Doma and Ala Mhigo in the flesh! I am Lina Mewrilah, correspondent for The Raven. You may recognize me from my exposé on the secret lives of the Homunculi.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Is there...a problem?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Mujih? That would be my sister. People mistake us all the time. Same profession, you see, and we do bear a passing resemblance. When last I heard, she was still assigned to the Botanists' Guild in Gridania, poor thing.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: But enough small talk. It's not for nothing that I've been standing here since yesterday morning on the off chance you'd pass by.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: No, I'm here because─ Actually, it's best you heard it from Alma. I am but an observer.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Alma, come! I've found herhim!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma-)Is this the adventurer of whom you spoke?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Indeed it is.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma-)Please! I beg of you! Find my father! You are his only hope!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: It's all right, Alma...

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: We are attracting unwanted attention. Might I suggest a change of venue?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: We will await you before the Prima Vista. The theater barge has a berth at the airship landing.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: I have never been one to meddle in the affairs of my clients...but if I were, I would say that you would be a fool not to follow those two back to their airship. Call it...a feeling.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: <sob>

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: As I said before, I think it better we continue this conversation in the privacy of the young lady's barge. It's not that I don't trust anyone here...it's simply that I don't trust anyone here.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Gate guard Minegumo has been instructed to look out for you. In future, speak with him when you wish to gain admission to the docks.

dialogue.name: AIRSHIPGUIDE03003
dialogue.text: You should speak with Lady Lina.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Forename.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: You're probably wondering why I've summoned you to an airship...and a Garlean one at that. Allow me to explain on the shuttle.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Prima Vista, the most luxurious theater barge in all the land!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: The Prima Vista serves as both stage and home to the Majestic Imperial Theater Company.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: You can keep that dirk in your drawers. No one here is a member of the imperial army, nor are there any spies within the troupe...at least, no known spies...

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Ask anyone and they will readily attest: the Majestic Imperial Theater Company are the finest practitioners of the dramatic arts to be found anywhere on the Three Great Continents...and beyond!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: They have admirers throughout the Empire and its territories─and even boast a sizable following in Gridania, hence my assignment to their story.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: It is a little-known fact, outside Garlemald at least, that the late emperor was a devoted patron of the arts who supported various theater troupes to the tune of much coin.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Indeed, Solus was so enamored of the Majestic players that he ordered the construction of this very airship, that the troupe might perform in every corner of the Empire.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: When his grandson took the throne, however, everything changed.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Now, all theater troupes domestic and foreign must submit their works for approval by the central imperial board of censors. If a play is deemed vulgar or inflammatory, it is banned and the troupe denied their writs of transit. The worst offenders? Well, they are never heard from again.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: This policy has effectively left playwrights with one of two options: compromise their creative integrity to curry favor with His Radiance, or put down their quills altogether.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: The principal of the Majestic, however, chose a third option: to express his disapproval for the new emperor's policies obliquely, in ostensibly unpolitical works.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)Pray forgive me for my earlier outburst. I am Alma bas Lexentale, daughter of Principal Jenomis cen Lexentale.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)Mayhap you have heard of my father's latest play, The Zodiac Brave Story? On the surface, it is an innocent retelling of a well-known Garlean faerie tale─hardly worthy of the censors' attention. But beneath, it is something quite different. A fact the censors failed to spot when they approved the manuscript for public performance.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)The play quickly became a huge success. The commonfolk loved its fantastical story, while the learned classes appreciated its true message.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: By the time the imperial board of censors realized their mistake, it was too late. No longer in a position to prohibit the performance outright without admitting fault, they took aim at the company's purse strings instead.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Before long, noble patrons began to withdraw their support, fearing to be associated with the troupe. And by the end, even the learned felt compelled to feign ignorance. By bleeding the Majestic of their funding, the censors robbed them of their voice.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: And...none of this has made it any clearer as to why you're here. Right.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Allow me, Lina.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I've known Jenomis since we were students at the Magitek Academy. When I heard his daughter was in Kugane looking to enlist the aid of an adventurer, I felt compelled to give her your name. Sorry for not announcing myself sooner, old friend.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Jenomis and I were from different worlds, but that only served to fuel our friendship. Many were the nights we would prattle on into the wee small hours─warm flagons of peated ale numbing our minds to the other's naive ideologies. Yet, no matter where our conversation began, it would invariably end with him telling me how he was going to change the Empire from the inside out. The troupe was to be his path into the people's hearts.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Even after the Empire forced him from his home, Jenomis never gave up hope that his work might change the world.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Jenomis cen Lexentale-)Art will ever strain against artificial bounds and borders! Man-made walls and misguided wars! It is in such times of uncertainty that we must needs embrace our calling and take to the skies so others might do the same!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What I am trying to say─rather poorly, I concede─is that not all Garleans are hewn from the same stone.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Just as there are those who pledge their lives to the Empire, and would never think to question the authority of its leaders, there are those like Alma's father and myself whose love for their country does not blind them to its flaws.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Still...try selling that sack of sun flour to an Ala Mhigan or a Doman who has watched his family consumed in the flames of a magitek reaper.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: How many Eorzean adventurers do you think would leap at the opportunity to help an imperial search for her missing father...and in Garlean territory, no less?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: But you─you are different. You have seen enough to know that the line between good and evil is not defined by race, color, or creed. So, what say you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I could never turn my back on a damsel in distress.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I would make a poor adventurer were I to shy from adventure.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)Oh, thank you. Thank you so much!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Indeed.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Now that you understand the nature of the task, perhaps Alma could provide some insight as to where we might begin our search.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)Shortly before my father disappeared, he began work on his next play─a successor to The Zodiac Brave Story.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Alma bas Lexentale-)Ah, but I am getting ahead of myself. Please, follow me...

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: ...through adventure and hardship, young Delita, a boy of common blood, becomes a hero, culminating in the birth of the mythical kingdom of Ivalice.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: But that is where the story ends. There are no records of anything that follows. Was Principal Jenomis simply going to invent something?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My father believed that he had discovered evidence of a second hero. One whose efforts went largely unnoticed, but without whom Delita would never have risen to the throne. His was the next tale he wanted to tell─the true Zodiac Brave Story.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: A second hero?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: According to my father's studies, this young man was one of Delita's closest friends and confidants─that is, until the untimely passing of Delita's sister forced the two to part ways.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Yet, the unnamed hero continued to provide aid to his friend by thwarting the machinations of those who would scheme against Delita, thus paving the way for the pauper's rise to regent.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: You must forgive me, but I've never heard anyone make such claims. How exactly did your father come by this information?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: That...is a long story...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: One which begins and ends with Jenomis becoming lost in the very legend he sought to lay bare.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Even as far back as our Academy days, Ivalice had Jenomis firmly in its grasp. He flatly refused to believe the story was just a faerie tale.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And so, when he was finally driven out of Garlemald, it was only natural that he should choose this of all places as his refuge─was it not, Alma?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: That is correct, Master Garlond. It has long been my father's belief that the ruins of ancient Ivalice lie beyond Nagxia, buried beneath the sands of the Dalmasca Desert.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Poor Dalmasca... The kingdom prospered in relative isolation for countless generations...until the Empire came calling.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: When not touring, my father would organize expeditions into the Dalmasca Desert to search for proof of Ivalice's existence. Sometimes he would bring back strange artifacts, ancient tomes...and crystals. Crystals unlike any others.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My father called them auracite and claimed they were vital to proving his theories. This is one such crystal.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... It's magnificent!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ivalician legend tells of crystals bequeathed by the gods unto those who would be kings. It is during his quest to gather auracite that young Delita rises to prominence.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I must have heard the tale a thousand times from my nursemaid. But that is all it ever was─a tale.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My father would often tell us how the auracite “spoke” to him. At the time, we assumed he was speaking figuratively─that the stones' beauty roused his muse.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But then he began to act strangely...

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: How so?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Following our arrival here in Hingashi, my father spent most of his time cloistered in his chambers, poring over his past research. And though he was alone, we could oft hear him in conversation.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: It was not uncommon for my father to recite the lines as he wrote them, but it soon became clear that this was something else.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: It was as if he was talking to my mother─my mother who passed several winters gone.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Might this not have been out of mere loneliness? Or perhaps the strain of your flight from Garlemald?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Possibly... But that would not explain the voices which answered him.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Alma! Who are these people? I told you I did not require any help finding Father, especially from outsiders.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: So good of you to join us, Ramza. Allow me to introduce─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Enough, Master Cid!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: We may be shunned by the Empire, but we are still Garleans, and we still have our pride...unlike some, it seems. We require neither the aid nor the pity of foreign rabble.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten where you are, Brother? It is we who are the “foreign rabble.” This land and its customs are all but unknown to us. We would be fools to conduct our search without a proven guide.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Your sister is right, Ramza. As for my good friend here, your mistrust is ill-placed. I will personally vouch for herhis character. In all the time I have known her, shehim, he has never once let anything as insignificant as race or creed color herhis judgment. You are lucky to have herhim.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But we would have you, Master Garlond! Why do you refuse us!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You know why. Until this affair with Omega is resolved, my hands are tied. It pains me to refuse you and your sister, but it pains me far more to leave Jenomis to his fate... I am sorry.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: You need not apologize. I let my emotions get the better of me... After what happened in Rabanastre, it may be time to admit we're out of our depth.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My brother's last expedition met with tragedy in the ruins of the capital city. He barely escaped with his life.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The Empire turned Rabanastre into a death trap. You were a fool to set foot there without a proper escort.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I realize that now, Master Garlond, but at the time, I saw an opportunity to rescue our father, and I took it.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Whatever led you to believe your father was in Dalmasca's capital?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My father's fascination with Ivalician legend began with a trip to the antediluvian city, long before the war. Call it a premonition, but something tells me that is where he has returned. Now you must excuse me. I need some time to think.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Then, Alma, I shall leave you and your brother in Forename's capable hands. SheHe has ever repaid my trust with interest. You would do well to grant herhim yours.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Master Garlond. We will not forget this kindness.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Cid didn't bid me farewell! This is going in my write-up!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Oh, how I miss my father...

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Master Garlond seems to think highly of you...so I will withhold judgment until after Dalmasca.
